message: This is largely my fault, but since it's happened twice it might be that there's a UI bug there encouraging me to do it.
For the second time, I've managed to click on the "mark all read" button at the top of the screen, when what I wanted to click on was something which displayed all the unread messages.
I think my mouse is attracted to the shiny read listing of the count of unread messages, and expects that clicking that will display those messages, rather than hide them from me.
+1, I've done the same thing a few times as well. All unintentional.
